poem:
### The Relics of Rooms

In the shadows of abandoned walls,  
a suitcase yawns—a silent scream,  
echoes of a sailor's secrets  
unmoored from time's neglect.  
Dynamite dreams and fragmented flesh,  
unholy relics of curious tides,  
found by hands unprepared,  
seeking only the light  
in the forgotten corners of life.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dynamite, sex toys – and liver? Readers on the weirdest things they’ve found in a new home ‘When I opened the suitcase, I fell backwards and screamed’ Our new house had once been the home of a ferry boat captain and his family. The previous owners requested that we dispose of anything left behind. “We’re going to find a body,” I told my husband as we considered the piles and piles of things in the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
